item.description:
Nina and I were contacted by one of the managers of the Village Gate Retirement Community in Farmington with a interesting offer: They'd let us use their space (their BEAUTIFUL space, I've since found!) for game nights in exchange for us "letting" a few of their 160 residents join us. We'll probably only get 10 or so of them the first time around  --  hopefully we'll get more of them and more of us each time!  It sounds like a win-win to me!


The residents there are VERY active. Their social calendar is booked to the gills: They literally have 6 - 8 activities scheduled every single day. I really don't get the impression that we'll be playing with residents who will fall asleep between turns or who will have too hard of a time picking up a new game or two.  Many of them still drive!  I'm excited to teach them Wizards, and I bet they'd get a kick out of Taboo or Apples to Apples, or whatever!

So here's the deal: I hope to do this every month, on the third Tuesday of the month. Bring whatever games you want to play, and bring a willingness to teach your games to some eager new friends.  They'll probably have some ideas, too, of course!

If you can, you're encouraged to bring a snack to share and BYOB. Alcohol or not is fine. Residents can imbibe if they choose to -- staff members just can't pour for them.

We won't ask residents to contribute to our group, but if you learned of the event through this site, please bring a Nina buck to help keep the group going!

 

Any questions?  Just ask!  :)
item.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the "South Living Room." Just ask one of the residents to direct you to it.
